page.title: Network-Free Specifications
page.introduction: For every model specified in a single compartment and having only mass-action kinetics, a modeler is able to create a new rule-based BioModel. Every rule-based enabled element of a model (molecules, observables, species with molecular details, reaction rules) are transferred to a new model without changes. Regular elements of a model (species without molecular detail and reactions) are converted into rule-based physiology by generating of molecule per species, and having reactions written as fully-defined reaction rules.
page.appearance: For user convenience, the Network-Free tab provides statistics of rule-enabled and regular elements of current model physiology, and the same stgatistics for the rule-based model to be created.
page.operations: Create New Rule-Based VCell BioModel generates a new BioModel and opens it in a new window.
